MacRae, Wendell, 1896-1980

Magazines
circa 1934 1934 date on magazines photographs reformatted digital preservation
still image Annotation on back: Governments, business, and medical societies have produced a health epidemic through radio and the press in recent years. But their message often fails to reach those most in need to its benefits. To fill this gap, AICP maintains health centers to spread health information in the community to women, housewives, tradesmen, teachers and school children. In schools about 25,000 children - in health centers, 2,060 - in homes, about 18,000 children were reached last year by AICP health programs. Description: Stamped on the back of the Photo: Wendell MacRae 5040 Tibbett Avenue New York City Attached to the back of the photo: Governments, business, and medical societies have produced a health epidemic through radio and the press in recent years. But their message often fails to reach those most in need to its benefits. To fill this gap, AICP maintains health centers to spread health information in the community to women, housewives, tradesmen, teachers and school children. In schools abotu 25,000 children - in health centers, 2,060 - in homes, about 18,000 children were reached last year by AICP health programs. Item no. 0866 Photograph no. MP-32
